title: Grammar and Mechanics: Complex Sentences

vocab.definition: A sentence that has one main idea and one or more dependent ideas
A word that connects words, phrases, or sentences (and, but, because)
A group of words that has a subject and a verb
A group of words that cannot stand alone as a sentence
A group of words that can stand alone as a complete sentence

teachingNotes: Teach students to identify and create complex sentences using subordinating conjunctions. Practice combining simple sentences into complex ones. Focus on proper punctuation and sentence variety.

sample.question: What punctuation is used when a dependent clause comes first?
Identify the dependent clause: 'Because it rained, the game was canceled.'
Identify the independent clause: 'Although she was tired, she finished her homework.'
Combine: 'I studied. I passed the test.' using 'because'.
expectedAny: I passed the test because I studied.

sample.question: Rewrite with dependent clause first: 'We went inside because it was cold.'
expectedAny: Because it was cold, we went inside.

truefalse.question: The word 'because' can be used to start a dependent clause.
An independent clause can stand alone as a sentence.
A comma is never used in a complex sentence.
If the dependent clause comes first, a comma follows it.
A dependent clause can stand alone.

multiplechoice.question: Which sentence is complex?
choices: Because it was raining, we stayed inside.
We stayed inside and watched a movie.
expectedAny: Because it was raining, we stayed inside.

multiplechoice.question: Where does the comma go?
choices: After the dependent clause when it comes first

multiplechoice.question: Identify the independent clause: 'When the bell rang, the class packed up.'
Which sentence places the dependent clause first?
choices: We left because it was late.
Because it was late, we left.
We left, because it was late.
It was late because we left.
expectedAny: Because it was late, we left.

multiplechoice.question: Which sentence is NOT complex?
choices: Although it snowed, school was open.
She went home because she felt sick.
When it stopped, we went outside.

multiplechoice.question: Which is the dependent clause? 'I finished my book after I ate dinner.'

fillintheblank.question: A ________ connects words, phrases, or sentences together.
An ________ clause can stand alone as a sentence.
Use a ______ when the dependent clause comes first.
A complex ________ has at least one dependent clause.
We can combine short sentences to improve ________ variety.

shortanswer.question: How do you combine two simple sentences into one complex sentence?
expectedAny: use a subordinating conjunction; make one clause dependent

shortanswer.question: Combine using 'although': 'It was cold. We went hiking.'
expectedAny: Although it was cold, we went hiking.

shortanswer.question: Correct the comma: 'Because I was late I missed the bus.'
expectedAny: Because I was late, I missed the bus.

shortanswer.question: Write a complex sentence about school.
Identify the conjunction and clauses: 'Since we finished early, we read quietly.'
Turn this into two sentences: 'When the bell rang we lined up.'
expectedAny: When the bell rang, we lined up.
